title: Clinical Virtual Reality Simulation-Based Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and ability to use digital devices
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers engage in an immersive learning environment analyzing clinical scenarios through mathematical modeling. VR simulations provide training in solving math problems using real medical data.

learning_goals: Learners can convert clinical data into mathematical models and analyze them in virtual reality environments

Learners analyze simulation data to design three or more math teaching strategies (e.g., visual modeling, gamified learning) applicable to real educational settings (grades 3–4). They must earn an "Excellent" rating in at least four of the five peer-evaluation rubric items.
Learners demonstrate mathematical reasoning skills in complex clinical scenarios through collaborative projects
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
